materials.raw_text: O (Oxygen) - 15.84 g, P (Phosphorus) - 3.96 g, Sb (Antimony) - 1.25 g, Sn (Tin) - 7.50 g, Tl (Thallium) - 0.50 g

sourcing.instructions: O: Obtain oxygen gas from a gas supplier or use distilled water and electrolysis to generate oxygen. P: Purchase white phosphorus from chemical suppliers. Sb: Source antimony from online chemical suppliers. Sn: Acquire tin from hardware stores or metal suppliers. Tl: Obtain thallium from specialized chemical suppliers.
steps: O: Obtain oxygen gas from a gas supplier or use distilled water and electrolysis to generate oxygen. P: Purchase white phosphorus from chemical suppliers. Sb: Source antimony from online chemical suppliers. Sn: Acquire tin from hardware stores or metal suppliers. Tl: Obtain thallium from specialized chemical suppliers.

1. Measure each ingredient accurately using a digital scale. 2. In a fume hood, combine 15.84 g of O, 3.96 g of P, 1.25 g of Sb, 7.50 g of Sn, and 0.50 g of Tl in a clean, dry ceramic crucible. 3. Stir the mixture thoroughly with a non-reactive rod to ensure uniform distribution of all components.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure each ingredient accurately using a digital scale. 2. In a fume hood, combine 15.84 g of O, 3.96 g of P, 1.25 g of Sb, 7.50 g of Sn, and 0.50 g of Tl in a clean, dry ceramic crucible. 3. Stir the mixture thoroughly with a non-reactive rod to ensure uniform distribution of all components.

steps: 1. Place the crucible in a programmable furnace. 2. Gradually heat the mixture to 800째C at a rate of 5째C/min. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and fusion of materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Place the crucible in a programmable furnace. 2. Gradually heat the mixture to 800째C at a rate of 5째C/min. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and fusion of materials.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature. 2. Avoid rapid cooling to prevent cracking (approximately 4-6 hours).
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature. 2. Avoid rapid cooling to prevent cracking (approximately 4-6 hours).

steps: 1. Carefully remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Trim any rough edges using a diamond saw or file. 3. Sand the surface to a smooth finish (starting with 400 grit and progressing to 2000 grit). 4. Optionally, seal the surface with a protective clear coat to enhance durability.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Carefully remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Trim any rough edges using a diamond saw or file. 3. Sand the surface to a smooth finish (starting with 400 grit and progressing to 2000 grit). 4. Optionally, seal the surface with a protective clear coat to enhance durability.
